concept.title: The scope attribute
concept.shortdesc: The scope attribute identifies the closeness of the relationship between the current document and the target resource.

conbody.draft-comment: The "opens in new window" really is a processor choice but has been encoded in the spec from the beginning - should we drop that language? There is no reason for the spec to require that "external" opens in a new window, and I'm not sure that the spec should tie that behavior to this value.
conbody.p: The scope attribute takes the following values:

dlentry.dd: Indicates that the resource is part of the current set of content.

ul.li: The resource is part of the current set of content, but it might not accessible at build time.
The resource should be treated as a root map for the purpose of creating map-to-map key references (peer maps).

dlentry.dd: Indicates that the resource is not part of the current information set.

conbody.p: If no value is specified for the scope attribute, the following considerations apply:

ul.li: In most cases, the processing default is local. However the processing default is external whenever the absolute URI in the href attribute begins with one of the following schemes: http, https, ftp, or mailto

conbody.p: Processors can consider additional URI schemes as external by default. Processors MUST always consider relative URIs as local by default.
